This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=AACORN.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-02T11:38:41Z Hilde Bollen 2015-03-02T11:37:39+00:00 2015-03-02T11:37:39+00:00 AACORN members at 2 March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;e6153166.1503 Dear AACORNers<br><br>Please find below the email list of AACORN members to date.<br><br>Late winter greetings from Copenhagen!<br><br>Hilde Arja Ropo 2015-02-10T18:00:30+02:00 2015-02-10T18:00:30+02:00 APROS/EGOS Call for submissions https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;f5a314f0.1502 Dear AACORNers,<br><br>Please consider submitting your work to our sub-theme \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRe-conceptualizing leadership and its development: Space, place and the virtual world\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd for the APROS/EGOS conference in Sydney 9-11 December 2015. The deadline for short papers 3000-4000 words is 1 May, 2015.<br><br>Best wishes to you all,<br><br>Arja Ropo<br><br>APROS/ EGOS Conference<br><br>Spaces, Constraints, Creativities: Organization and Disorganization [...] Hancock, Philip G 2015-02-10T15:52:06+00:00 2015-02-10T15:52:06+00:00 <No subject> https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;4e24624b.1502 Have you read Gibson Burrell's chapter in Utopia and Organization (2002) editor M. Parker. You might find that useful in terms of thinking about 'landscaping', organization and power.<br><br>Certainly they are highly intertwined, even if only in terms of spatial organization and technology.<br>From: Stephen Carroll <scarroll@RHSMITH.UMD.EDU<mailto:scarroll@RHSMITH.UMD.EDU>><br>Reply-To: Stephen Carroll <scarroll@RHSMITH.UMD.EDU<mailto:scarroll@RHSMITH.UMD.EDU>><br>Date: Friday, 6 February 2015 20:52<br>To: "Aesthetics, Creativity, and Organisations Research Network" <AACORN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<mailto:AACORN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK>><br>Subject: <no subject> [...] Stephen Linstead 2015-02-07T07:33:37+00:00 2015-02-07T07:33:37+00:00 Fwd: 'The Philosophy of Dance' - new entry on Stanford Encyclopedia for Philosophy https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;c3b6cddf.1502 This might be of iterest to members<br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: "Performance Philosophy" <mail@performancephilosophy.ning.com><br>Date: 13 Jan 2015 07:49<br>Subject: 'The Philosophy of Dance' - new entry on Stanford Encyclopedia for<br>Philosophy<br>To: "stephen.linstead@york.ac.uk" <stephen.linstead@york.ac.uk><br>Cc:<br><br>Dear all<br>I thought members might be interested to see this useful new entry on 'The<br>Philosophy of Dance' that has been added to the Stanford Encyclopedia of<br>Philosophy, by Dr. Aili Bresnahan - a lecturer in philosophy at the<br>University of Dayton in Ohio, USA.<br>See http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/dance/<br>Aili will continue to update the entry in future, so is open to receiving<br>constructive [...] Monika Kostera 2015-02-06T21:45:54+00:00 2015-02-06T21:45:54+00:00 Call for papers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;ade35cef.1502 Dear All,<br><br>Please find attached a call for chapters for our (Michael Pirson's<br>and mine) edited book on management and dignity<br><br>Please feel invited to contribute<br><br>all the best wishes<br><br>M.<br><br>Monika Kostera<br>Professor Ordinaria<br>www.kostera.pl Stephen Carroll 2015-02-06T15:52:11-05:00 2015-02-06T15:52:11-05:00 <No subject> https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;d59f617d.1502 Colleagues,<br><br>Last evening I attended a lecture on the historical changes<br>in English gardens as initiated by famous English historical individuals.<br>A "Capability Brown" was one of these<br>great garden designers in England. She also discussed the influences<br>of Catherine the Great of Russia and others on the design of<br>gardens. The lecture was presented by a lawyer who has visited all the<br>significant gardens in Europe and has taken thousands of photographs<br>of them. She refers to gardens as living paintings. She traced the<br>evolution of gardens in England from natural and then through various types<br>of formal gardens [...] Ralph Kerle 2015-02-03T09:22:42+11:00 2015-02-03T09:22:42+11:00 Re: A paper on conferences https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;5f377b96.1502 Hi Catherine,<br><br>Nice work!<br><br>Ralph<br><br>From: Aesthetics, Creativity, and Organisations Research Network<br>[mailto:AACORN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Maverick Minds<br>Sent: Monday, 2 February 2015 12:03 PM<br>To: AACORN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: A paper on conferences<br><br>Hi Everyone<br><br>I recently wrote a paper that was published in the Action Learning Action<br>Research Journal<br><br>it's about conferences and in particular using creative interventions.<br><br>I talk about a few conferences i have been involved with and of course the<br>York Art of Management and Organization conference features with the City of<br>Thought that I had the great privilege of working with Daved Barry and<br>Henrik Schrat. [...] Maverick Minds 2015-02-02T21:35:36+10:00 2015-02-02T21:35:36+10:00 Re: your brilliant paper on artful inquiry in conferences! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;4d7fc90b.1502 Hello Ariane<br><br>Thank you so much for reading the paper and also for your positive thoughts.<br><br>Yes it is good to see journal publications reaching out and being prepared to publish different sorts of papers - just as it should be in my view.<br><br>I look forward to hearing your reflections at some stage as well. [...] Ariane Berthoin Antal 2015-02-02T09:43:11+01:00 2015-02-02T09:43:11+01:00 your brilliant paper on artful inquiry in conferences! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;b0eb79e9.1502 Dear Cathryn,<br>thank you so much for sharing your new paper describing and reflecting on<br>your experiences with artful inquiry in conference settings. Your work is<br>really original and it is encouraging not only to see the results you have<br>achieved but also the fact that a journal will publish a paper on this<br>topic. Anke Strau\ufffd\ufffd and I experimented with various ways of leading "artful<br>research conversations" at the WZB Berlin Social Science Center and in<br>various conference settings (e.g., EGOS and the Academy of Management)<br>over the past 6 years but have not yet written up our experiences; [...] Maverick Minds 2015-02-02T11:02:58+10:00 2015-02-02T11:02:58+10:00 A paper on conferences https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;3ade3072.1502 Hi Everyone<br><br>I recently wrote a paper that was published in the Action Learning Action Research Journal<br><br>it’s about conferences and in particular using creative interventions.<br><br>I talk about a few conferences i have been involved with and of course the York Art of Management and Organization conference features with the City of Thought that I had the great privilege of working with Daved Barry and Henrik Schrat. [...] Monika Kostera 2015-02-01T10:39:19+00:00 2015-02-01T10:39:19+00:00 Call for short stories https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;1ebf7d0f.1502 Dear All,<br><br>I am collecting short fictive stories for a study about the future of<br>the university, using the method of narrative collage (some<br>explanation below).<br><br>I've be very happy if you could write a story beginning with the<br>sentence below, and send it to me before February 28th:<br><br>The big banner by the entrance proclaimed: "Happy New Year 2021!" A<br>group of students entered campus and looked around. Adam spoke first:<br>"Don't know about you, but I..." She came<br>> to the University of Maryland in the mid 1990s to play center on the<br>> highly ranked Maryland woman's basketball team which she did for four<br>> years.She received a BA and later a [...] Stephen Carroll 2015-01-14T15:24:38-05:00 2015-01-14T15:24:38-05:00 <No subject> https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;cc9a63f9.1501 I would like to recommend my former student (and protege) Nina Ohman<br>as a member of AACORN. Nina is from Helsinki Finland which is where<br>she has been living for the past two years while completing her<br>dissertation in Music from the University of Pennsylvania. She came<br>to the University of Maryland in the mid 1990s to play center on the<br>highly ranked Maryland woman's basketball team which she did for four<br>years.She received a BA and later a MBA from the School of Business.<br>From 1997 to 2007 she was a project coordinator for the World Bank<br>based in [...] Charles Wankel 2015-01-10T17:02:11-05:00 2015-01-10T17:02:11-05:00 Can you do a chapter on how you integrate art/theater/dance/film into your courses? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;a6340b01.1501 Integrating Curricula and Co-Curricula Endeavors to Enhance Intellectual,<br>Intercultural, Global, Community, and Personal Student Outcomes<br><br>Charles Wankel, St John's University, New York, and Laura A. Wankel,<br>Northeastern University, Boston<br><br>Call for Chapter proposals<br><br>Can you do a chapter on how you integrate art/theater/dance/film into your<br>courses? In too many ways higher education is still a series of silo-like<br>endeavors rather than collaborative integrated fabrics. Integrating<br>classroom learning with out of class experience designed to produce<br>significant outcomes remains elusive and haphazard. Evidence that<br>significant student learning and development takes place in multiple venues<br>such as internships, service learning, clubs and [...] BENGHOZI Pierre-jean 2015-01-01T21:23:07+00:00 2015-01-01T21:23:07+00:00 RE : Greetings from CBS Art Initiative and invitation to a Stockholm symposium with Graham Harman https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AACORN;93de5534.1501 Congratulations, Pierre, for such an inspiring and relevant project. My new regulator responsibilities make it more constrained my calendar and I cannot attend the event but I should be happy to share with you on this topic on occasion, over lunch or a drink, at one of your next bus in Paris.<br>Wishing you and our Aacorners friends a happy new year.
